TextView.android:text: 1)Candela is the unit of which?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n A common candle emits light with a luminous intensity of roughly one candela. \n This is how we are calculating the luminous intensity of the light in terms of candela.
2)Solid angle is expressed in terms of
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 The steradian or squared radian is derived from the Greek stereos for solid and the radius 
 for ray and beam. A steradian is related to the surface area of a sphere in the same way a 
 radian is related to the circumference of a circle. A steradian can be defined as the solid 
 angle subtended at the center of a unit sphere by a unit area on its surface.
3) Which lamp has the best Colour Rendering Index (CRI)?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n The visual spectrum of incandescent lamp is continuous and therefore the CRI is 100 \n which is maximum for any lamp.
4)Which cells in the eye are responsible for scotopic vision?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Scotopic vision deals with night vision which is controlled by rod cells.
5)What is the ratio of illuminance at a point 5m just below a lamp emitting 100 candelas \n and at a point 5m away from the first point on the same horizontal plane?
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 From figure shown below 
 Illuminance at point A = 100/52 = 4 
 Illuminance at point B = 100 × cos 45/OB2 = 50√2/ (5√2)2 = √2.
6) Which lamps can be directly connected to a solar cell?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n The output of a solar cell is DC and LEDs operate on DC.
7)Candela/metre square is the unit of which photometric quantity?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Luminance is the luminous intensity per unit projected area.
8)Which lamp is best suited for lighting an International sports arena?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Metal halide lamps have luminous efficacy in the range of 80-100 lm/watt and a CRI of \n above 90. So they are best suited for lighting an International sports arena.
9)What is the work of a driver in case of an LED?

RadioButton.android:text: A) To convert AC to DC

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option A \n LEDs operate on DC. So when they are to be operated on AC supply, a driver is neede\n which converts AC to required DC value.d
10)What will be the number of lamps, each having 300 lumens, required to obtain an \n average illuminance of 50 lux on a 4m × 3m rectangular room?
View Answer
11)The range of visual spectrum is
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n The visual spectrum lies in between the UV spectrum on its left to Infra-red spectrum to its right. Its range is 380nm -760nm.
12)Which lamp has a negative Colour Rendering Index (CRI)?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Low pressure sodium vapour lamp has a monochromatic spectrum and therefore has a negative CRI.
13)A 1000 W bulb fitted with a reflector illuminates an area of 3 m x 3 m with an average illumination of 450 lux. If the bulb has an efficiency of 9 lumens / watt, the efficiency of the reflector is
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n
14)What will be the total flux emitted by a source of 60 candle power?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Total flux = (4 X 3.14 X 60) lumens = 754.2 lumens.

15)From a uniform light source having luminous intensity of 300 candelas, there exists a plane surface 15 m below. The value of illuminance at a point on the plane surface where the luminous flux rays are inclined at an angle of 30 to the surface is
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 From the laws of illumination, 
 Illuminance = Intensity × cosine of the angle of inclination of light rays/ Distance2 
 E = I Cosθ/d2 = 300 × cos 30/225 = 1.15 lux
16)The solid angle subtended by an area of 2400 cm2 on the surface of a sphere of diameter 1.2 m is
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n
17)In illumination technology total lumens emitted by source / total lumens available after waste of light is equal to
View Answer

Answer : Option A \n Total lumens emitted by source / total lumens available after waste of light is equal to waste light factor. It is about 1.2 for rectangular area, 1.5 for irregular objects - statues, monuments etc.
18) The illumination at a point 5 meters below a lamp in 6 lux. The candle power of the lamp is
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n
19)Which among the following lamps has the maximum burning hours?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n LEDs have very high burning hours of about 500000 hours.
20)A 200 candle power lamp is hung 4 m above the centre of circular area of 5 m diameter. The illumination at centre of the area is
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n According to law of inverse square the illumination can be given as,
